editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Scholars of Merton College.

msItem.author: JOHN DUNS SCOTUS
msItem.title: Quodlibeta
msItem.explicit: (ends impf. in q. 21; edn. p. 541 sect. 14) potest aliquis ratiocinare de agendis et ita

msItem.author: JOHN DUNS SCOTUS
msItem.title: Collationes Oxonienses
msItem.incipit: (Beg. impf. towards the end of q. 6) nec debet poni quomodo includit contradictionem ex ratione
msItem.explicit: (ends impf. in q. 24) necesse esse ergo quocunque posito
msItem.note: DSO (Wadding) 3. 339-430. Nos 6-19, 21, 23-4 are Wadding 34, 12, 32-3, 31, 21, 13, 22, 27, 25, 24, 35, 14, 16, 15, 28, 29; nos 20 and 22 pr. C. R. S. Harris, Duns Scotus (2 vols, Oxford, 1927), II, pp. 371-8; Glorieux, Théol. 344u2. The text differs considerably from the printed version.

msItem.author: JOHN DUNS SCOTUS
msItem.title: Collationes Parisienses
msItem.incipit: (Beg. impf. in q. 3; ed. Wadding, p. 361) non esset delectacio tum quia talis actio
msItem.explicit: alia in Filio et sic de Spiritu Sancto ergo &c
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit collacio Parisiensis doctoris subtilis scripta per me Iohnnem Reynboldi de Monte Ornato Almanicum anno Domini millesimo CCCC lvi
msItem.note: Originally 19 quaestiones, the first fifteen as DSO(Wadding) 3. 339-430, nos 6, 7, 2-4, 17-18, 9-11, 20, 36-9; then follow two pr. from this and MS 90 by Harris, Duns Scotus, II, pp. 361-70; Glorieux, Théol. 344u1; eight copies are listed in DSO(Balic) 1. 151*. The text differs much from the printed version. On f. 110v is an index of the tituli in the elegant humanistica of MS 60 &c.

msItem.author: JOHN DUNS SCOTUS
msItem.title: De Primo Principio
msItem.incipit: Primum rerum principium michi ea credere sapere
msItem.explicit: (ends impf. in c. 4. 4) quia tamen de simplicitate essentiali (catchwords:) intelligo hoc
msItem.note: ed. and transl. A. B. Wolter (Chicago, ILL, 1983), pp. 3-75; Glorieux, Théol. 344h.

msItem.author: ?JOHN DUNS SCOTUS
msItem.title: De Perfectione Statuum
msItem.incipit: Quod status prelatorum ecclesiasticorum presupponit statum alium
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit opus doctoris subtilis intitulatum Duns de perfectione statuum. Scriptum per me Iohannem Reynboldi Almanicum de Monte Ornato anno Domini millesimo CCCC lvi

msItem.author: FRANCIS DE MEYRONNES
msItem.title: De Dominio Apostolorum
msItem.incipit: Vtrum apostoli habuerunt bonorum dominium in communi. Et uidetur quod sic, quia Act. 4 c. dicit Sanctus Lucas quod erant omnia communia
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit questio Francisci de Maronis de dominio apostolorum scriptum per me ..
msItem.note: unpr.; Roth, Franz von Mayronis, pp. 240-3.

msItem.author: FRANCIS DE MEYRONNES
msItem.title: De Principatu Temporali
msItem.incipit: Vtrum ille qui principatur secundum iurisdictionem uniuersalem tamquam monarcha debeat de iure naturali subiacere se illi qui principatur secundum plenitudinem potestatis in spiritualibus quo ad omnia que debet ierarcha. Circa quam questionem dicunt ciuiliste quod princeps
msItem.explicit: tenet ecclesie triumphantis, cuius nos conciues faciat Ihesus Christus amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit questio Francisci de Maronis de subiectione .... Scripta per me ...
msItem.note: unpr.; Roth, Franz von Mayronis, pp. 239-40.

msItem.title: 'De duodecim lapidibus Apocalypsis'
msItem.incipit: Ciues superne patrie in Ihesum concinite qui est suppremus opifex ciuitatis uranice in cuius edificio talis extat fundacio. Iaspis colore uiridi
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit rithmus uenerabilis Bede presbiteri de duodecim lapidibus preciosis qui numerantur in fine Apocalipsis scilicet capitulo 21
msItem.note: SKI 1126; WIC 2812 (‘Ciues caelestis patriae’); ed. P. Kitson in Anglo-Saxon England 12 (1983), 73–123, at pp. 115–20. This copy, his S (p. 111), may have been made directly from that in BL, Roy. 8 G. vi, f. 159rv (Tattershall College, Lincs., s. xv1). This copy seen by John Bale (Appendix C, no. 6).

msItem.author: FRANCIS DE MEYRONNES
msItem.title: De Indulgentiis
msItem.incipit: Quodcumque ligaueris super terram ...; Duos fines ultimos futuros esse in fine seculi describit beatus Augustinus
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit sermo uenerabilis doctoris fratris Francisci de Maronis predicatus in Assiso tempore indulgenciarum in presencia domini pape et cardinalium de indulgenciis
msItem.colophon: Scriptus per me Iohannem Reynboldi de Monte Ornato Almanicum anno Domini millesimo CCCC lvi
msItem.note: pr. Basel 1498; Roth, Franz von Mayronis, pp. 236-9; Bloomfield 4895; Schneyer 131.

supportDesc.extent:
156 leaves (i + 155) 365 265
255 145
The edges savagely retrimmed, affecting marginalia and catchwords, and spattered with red. f. i is of thick, stiff parchment.
supportDesc.collation: a singleton, 18 (1 mutil.), 2-88, a single leaf, hooked round quire 8, was the first in a quire now lost, 9-138, 148(lacks 6-8), 15-178, 188(lacks 4), 198, 208(lacks 6-8), a singleton; catchwords, placed as in MS 60. One or more quires is lost after 15. Losses of leaves are signalled on ff. 65v and 66 (s. xvii, referring to the printed edn. of 1639), and 90.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 52 long lines.

handDesc.handNote: As 59. The scribe writes passages of gloss in the margins in a tiny hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: As 59. Major initials and borders are on ff. 1 (mostly excised), 111, 119, 138, 144v, and 149.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii; sewn on five bands; formerly chained from the usual position. f. 155 was formerly a pastedown.

history.provenance: As for MS 59. Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with a table of contents, s. xvii, ‘N. 5. 10. Art:’, s. xvii, canc. and replaced with ‘G. 3. 5 (LXV)’, in red, and the College bookplate. Titles in a hand of s. xvi occur at the head of f. 2, partly cropped, and showing that the damage to f. 1 had already occurred. ‘7’ is inked on the foredge.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, pp. 39-40; Powicke, no. 985; Watson, Dated and Datable Oxford, no. 837; Alexander & Temple, no. 572.
